Pros:
1. Looks attractive and does not eat to much space.
2. Ideal for a small room
3. Satellite speaks are decent
4. Remote is very nice and has a good response.
5. Connecting on pc/FM/Bluetooth/aux is super easy and does not even require to connect to manual.
6. Make sure when connecting to pc or any device via wire, press the Aux button in remote

Cons:
1. Sub woofer is too small and does not contribute well to your sound experience.
2. Woofer effect is almost not present or it's not powerful enough to give you any thump as it should. Don't expect this to give you that thump, it will not.
3. I find the cables to short to place the satellite speakers well.
4. There is distortion in sound, if you keep Bass even to half of its capacity and then everything get shaky.

Overall do not buy this and but FD has a good speakers in upper range. So, add few buck to your shopping and go for top range.

FD is good with the hardware and I would still recommend FD in top range, as my previous speakers from FD survived more than 5 years and never gave a problem and I had a good sound experience with it.

Well that said, this product is still ideal for someone listening to songs that would not involve loud thumps from the bass and just want to enjoy Bluetooth connectivity/FM/USB in small space with very little to spend.

I hope you have glanced through many other reviews' already, so i would like to scribble some points which i didnt find in other reviews'.
First of all dimensions
Sub: length 17cm width 26cm height 27.5cm
Sat : length 10cm width 7.5cm height 16 cm
Pros'
1. The sound is of good quality with appreciable amount of bass for the small sized unit.
2. Fm is good though i tried in a region with very less reception of the same.
3. Bass adjustment switch.
4. Pretty good remote which can be easily operated unlike the cheap ones which need to pointed exactly towards the reception area.
5. Bluetooth is working fine and pairs easily with average range...like within the room or adjacent one max.
6. A cable for connecting dth or tv or the like....is provided....which has av sockets at one end and the 3.5 mm stereo jack at the other end for connection to other devices like the mentioned.
7. A wire runs out from the side which acts as fm antenna and could be extended in case you need to place atenna outside.
8. Display is bright and readable which provides necessary info like usb or bt or fm and volume plus it indicates power or standby.
Cons.
1. The power switch is on the side panel of sub. In addition you can turn it off in remote controller which is easy, but doing so doesn't cut the power to the main board since it gets heated and also it powers the usb drive that you have plugged in, which turns it hot.
2. The initial volume level, i.e. , level 1 itself is very loud which turns to be a great drawback when you dont want to disturb others.
3. The device doesn't have a memory to store settings, so once you turn off the power plug, and you turn it on next time it starts with a very high volume say level 12 or so. However it remains in the same mode...i.e. ...bt or usb or so.... that you have last used it before power off.

Altogether it is a recommended product. The packing is the same company packing just cling wrapped. The product seems to be original with all stickers and warranty card and all. The product is also not much heavy. The sub box is made of wood.
Thank you.

The stylish and sleek wooden cabinet
Good built quality given the price
Great bluetooth reception and wireless experience
USB port, SD card reader, Aux port and great FM reception
Good and thumping bass, as per the subwoofer specifications
Perfect for medium sized room with good remote range
Crystal clear vocal experience both on highs and lows

I did try few other brands at this price including some slightly pricier ones and some of them have been harsh on the ears to be honest. This wonderful tower is a great buy at this steal away price.

Try this out if you also believe in Vocal for Local like me and trust me, you won’t be disappointed.

Test any system somewhere before purchasing it as you may suffer and regret with ht 144 kind of system. Obage people correctly mention it as not for loud listeners...Volume output will never satisfy a heartful listener one who wants to enjoy the song. I have been using this hometheatre system for last 10 days with all different kind of setups - Movie, music, gaming
So I believe am ready to give a review from a regular user usage feedback .
Firts things first
I got the product from the seller- Appario retail and they have given me an already opened + used product and I was really shocked to see that.
I was thinking whether to return it on the same day but thought of using it for once to see if it has any defects.
but surprisingly the speaker was all fine, dint fine any issues or something. so decided to keep the product anyway , so a bid thumb's down for the seller Appario retailers.
now coming back to the speaker performance
I don't knw why many reviews says that the Bass is not good, for me the bass is just perfect, I only set the bass level to 6 or to 8 max(out of 12) and the bass just pumps in perfectly and shakes my room pretty good.
I have been using it with PS4,LAPTOP,Tv, and Mobile and every ports does work but only the HDMI and Optical outputs 5.1 with ofcourse 5.1 content.
But worst+sad+bad thing with the setup is the sound bar channel seperation. i would say its 0 out of 5, yes the sound clarity is just sony level but u can't get or feel the front left+center+front right channel seperation from the sound bar, you can only feel the seperation if u sit just infront of the sound bar and within 1 meter distance, if you sit far than this u will just feel it like a 3.1 system ( 1 left rear + 1 right rear+ 1 front speaker) so u really won't get the Dolby theatre like feeling from this speakers even though they are marketed as a 5.1 I would suggest to go for Individual 5.1 speaker setup rather than the sound var setup if u r really a guy like me who give importance to the surrounding effect.
so this is my verdict,
if u just want a really good speaker system for music+regular media watching this speakers are fine, but if u mainly get this for the home theatre 5.1 experience dont go for it, go for a system which has either separate channel speakers or a better soundbar which can may be give much more channel seperation
thnx

Modern LED TV has come a long way to shed the tag of being an idiot box. Now your LED TV house several patents and you can find the word "Smart" tagged to your TV.
If you look at the journey from being an idiot box to becoming a smart TV several issues have been addressed to make your viewing experience flawless.

However, if there is anything short in a LED TV it's the sound. Blame it on the sleek design or sheer negligence of designers, the sound in any LED TV is always far from satisfactory.

So I started my journey to seek the best companion for my TV and finally ended up with this.

I am not a geek when it comes to speakers. So here is my review in layman's language after 2 weeks of use/Abuse.

The Good Part

1. Bass, yes you heard it clear, Bass - Powerful Woofers, good enough to compete with the bachelor's party next door.
2. Design - The unit looks sturdy at the same time sleek.
3. Bluetooth performance - There is absolutely no delay in pairing and no breakage once its paired
4. Clear music with no hissing sound even at high volume. A wholesome experience while watching movies.
5. A cute but functional remote to make your life easy.
6. Good connectivity options- Bluetooth/Aux/SD Card Reader/Pen Drive.
7. FM, if you are into listening radio.

The Not So Good Part

1. I would have rated the product 5 if it were not for cheap LED lights. The moment the led light kicks in you get a feel of
a low-end Chinese product. Though there is an option to switch this off, it comes back once you restart the speaker.

2. An NFC pairing would have made the experience even better.

3. You need to find a delicate balance between bass and treble to make the most out of this speaker.

4. Missing option in remote to control the bass and treble.

Conclusion

A must buy if you struggling with the poor quality audio of your TV.

I have been using 301 for some time and loving it. I wanted to buy another sound system for my other room, so I called up Obage customer care. Those guys really guide well. I was surprised to know that 101, despite being costlier than 301, has lesser sound output than 301. But the cost difference is due to sound quality, not sound quantity.
So i bought 101 as I wanted soothing sound for my room.

I used 101 for few days and reached the following conclusion :

301 is for those people who like loud music, boomy bass, crisp highs. The loudness of 301 is certainly more than 101. 301 is a very bright sound system in terms of sound.

101 is very clear and soothing. It has deeper bass than 301. I was amazed to see that 101 reaches down to 40Hz of bass which is phenomenal for this cost. Highs are very decent in 101. For long hours of listening, 101 is perfect. It takes a certain amount of time for ears to get adjusted to the sound of 101 as it is very melodious, and once the ears get accustomed to 101, it is addictive! The sound stage of 101 is very wide and detailed. I can listen to all instruments clearly on 101. But 101 is not at all loud.

Now, when I am in a mood of listening to classical, ghazals, soft music, English Rock, hip hop, I go to 101. Even songs of Arijit or latest bollywood movies, if I want to listen on less sound, I go to 101. It is best for peaceful listening.

I go to 301 when i want to listen to loud music, bollywood item numbers, or even disturb the neighbors sometimes hahaha. 301 really spices up the surrounding.

My verdict : 301 is spicy, 101 is sweet. I love them both!

I bought this boat Aavante Soundbar on 6th of August. I received the product on 7th, so the delivery was good.

The packaging of the product was also good.
-Coming to the product, we get a Soundbar, a wirless sub woofer, both powered individually.

-The box contains a remote, a 3.5 mm audio cable and some screws for wall mount.

-Build quality:

The product is well built. The subwoofer is of good quality wood. On first inspection, I found the grill to be a little filmsy in the front of the soudbar. So overall I would rate it 4/5.

-Sound quality:
The sound quality on this soundbar is really good. It has good highs with decent mids as well.
-The bass on the sub woofer is also good. But it lacks some strong kick to the bass.

-Connectivity: The best part of this soundbar is connectivity. It has all the ports that are needed for a soundbar. I tested with 3.5 mm audio jack and Bluetooth and both worked flawlessly.

I bought this at the price of ₹5400 including HDFC cards discount. So at this price it is a steal deal. I would update this review over time.

~~~~~~~~~~~~

♦ Audio is NOT loud probably for Bed-room types, but perfect for long time listening!

Who should buy?
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
1. For listening Instruments and musics
2. For classical musics (Beethoven)
3. Jazz lovers
4. Bass lovers (Who are On low budget!)

--> Don't forget to Burn-in

IMPORTANT NOTE:

First off all, getting a good surround system is dependent not only on the speakers but many other factors. Your experience is going to be poor no matter which sound system you buy unless you consider for these factors.

To get a good surround sound system you should consider:

1. Whether the content you're playing has a 5.1ch sound output in the first place

2. Whether the app and/or device you're playing it in supports a 5.1ch output (for e.g. YouTube app does not have a 5.1ch output)

3. Whether your connectivity supports a 5.1ch output; not all devices/connections support 5.1ch (for e.g. if you connect the speakers through a normal 3.5mm jack, you'll only get a stereo output)

So when comments here say the "5.1 doesn't work" take that not with a pinch of salt but with 'bunch' of salt.

I have been using the sound system for a little over 2 months and I can say with 100% confidence that it works with absolute charm!!

Therefore before you go ahead and make this purchase, please do find out if the device that you intend to hook this up with, has the capability to output 5.1ch through HDMI Arc connection. Not all TVs/devices support this, therefore you'll end up having all the devices but not getting the surround system feel.

Now coming to the sound system in itself.

It is a bit of a bummer that the Front Right, Centre and Front Left are in a single sound bar. Ideally you would want them to be slightly spaced. But there is the advantage of the soundbar fitting snugly right below the TV and looking pretty cool. It does give an artificial "spacing", so no complains here.

The Surround Left and Right satellites come with a 10m long wire. They need to be placed at 90-110° from where you sit and since most ideal TV viewing distances are less than 4m, there shouldnt be a problem with lack of length.

Please Google for speaker placement for 5.1ch and you'll come across Dolby recommended positions. Follow that and you're good to go!

The sound itself is amazing! Gives a very good cinematic experience (assuming you have considered all the aforementioned 3 factors). With HDMI Arc connectivity, you should be able to control the speaker volume with your TV remote itself, but this is something that you need to check with your TV.
